data.title: minizip fails building on Gentoo because they broke the upstream API for dubious reasons (error: expected initializer before 'OF')
data.body:
Opening the issue for @Zatsuwar based on https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/10428#issuecomment-323783105

----

**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Gentoo, master branch

GCC - gcc (Gentoo 4.9.4 p1.0, pie-0.6.4) 4.9.4
Clan - clang version 3.9.1

Both clang and gcc give-me error.

**Issue description:**
I`m getting errors to compile in my Gentoo, this fallowing errors:

[Initial build] Compiling ==> main/main.cpp In file included from ./thirdparty/minizip/unzip.h:55:0, from ./core/io/file_access_zip.h:38, from main/main.cpp:68: ./thirdparty/minizip/ioapi.h:127:51: error: expected initializer before 'OF' typedef voidpf (ZCALLBACK open_file_func) OF((voidpf opaque, const char filename, int mode)); .....

Complete log: https://ghostbin.com/paste/2kh96

I also tried "minizip=no" but still don't work.

**Steps to reproduce:**
I am running:
```
scons platform=x11 
```
and
```
scons platform=x11 bits=64 tools=no target=release_debug -j 9 use_llvm=yes
```

data.title: Fix unneeded separator in Script Editor's Debug menu
data.body: Fixes  #10528

data.title: editor fails to compile and run on windows and may be mac
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 10 x64 c2346b92b285a50bb85fe935763d25e043fa3e5c

**Issue description:**
I saw that svg support was merged 8 hours ago and was very agitated to test it, went to Calinou's repo and found out that there is only linux executable. Then i've downloaded latest master and launched compilation (vs2017) and it finished, but gave me only 32 bit exe. So i've launched it, created a new project and.... it crashed while opening the main editor window with:
Unhandled exception at 0x77569AAA (ntdll.dll) in godot.windows.tools.32.exe: 0xC0000374: A heap has been corrupted (parameters: 0x775A58E8)

data.title: Fixed build for Visual Studio
data.body:
This commit fixes an issue which breaks compilation with Visual Studio 2015. The file editor/editor_icons.gen.h does not need to be in the editor_sources list. Visual Studio does not recognize the extension .gen.h and assumes it to be an object file, causing error LNK1136.

Fixes #10532

data.title: Hidden lights and meshes still contribute to the GIProbe solution
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Win10 and LinuxMint...current Godot3 builds

**Issue description:**
When using lights, meshes and meshes with emission materials and the giprobe, if they are set as non-visible in the scene tree, they still are seen by the GIProbe calculations.

In the following image, the hidden objects(light, cube and mesh emitter) on the right still contribute to the gi solution, when they are expected not to. This is problematic when setting up the lighting for a scene, as you often want to toggle objects/lights on and off when assembling a scene. 

Currently you have to delete an object(or constantly fiddle with material or light settings) to know exactly what the result will be. Note that you can also see the hidden objects in the giprobe reflections (reverse vampire effect!)

![hidden_objects_gi](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/29546686-20b02a06-8739-11e7-8577-51843962a001.jpg)

**Steps to reproduce:**
- hide objects(mesh, light, mesh light) within a giprobe setup.


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

[hidden_emission_test.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1240650/hidden_emission_test.tar.gz)

data.title: Texture mapping emission does not work with GIProbe
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Win10 and Linux Mint...current master build of Godot3


**Issue description:**
When using a texture map in the emission channel, there is no contribution to the GIProbe calculation.

In the following image, the mesh on the left has 3 separate materials (as polygroup selections). It has no maps, just color in the emission channel. It is working as expected.

The mesh on the right has one single material with a texture map in the emission channel. It should give a similar result to the mesh on the left but contributes nothing to the gi solution. The emission color is black which overrides the map color.

![emitters1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7741669/29546117-a30bfd58-8735-11e7-9ed5-5bde5da83f11.jpg)




**Steps to reproduce:**
- add an image in the emission channel of a spatial material. 
- add this material to a mesh
- add a giprobe


**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

[map_emission_test.tar.gz](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1240608/map_emission_test.tar.gz)

data.title: Reindhart tonemapping is broken

Win10 and Linux Mint


**Issue description:**
When Reindhart tonemapping is selected in the environment node, the result is a pure white screen. It doesn't matter what is in the scene or what settings are used. The 3 other tone mapping options work correctly.


**Steps to reproduce:**
- add environment node
- select tone mapping option Reindhart

data.title: Fatal Error: Cannot open include file 'editor_icons.h' and 'Error 1136'
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Godot Alpha 3.0, Windows 10

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

Frequently I update the Godot Engine by the source code and recently around 51% of the compiling process, it ran into this fatal error:

```
editor_icons.gen.cpp
editor\editor_icons.gen.cpp(1): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'editor_icons.h': No such file or directory
scons: *** [editor\editor_icons.gen.windows.tools.64.obj] Error 2
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```
So I checked the 'editor_icons.gen.cpp' file and see that the `#include editor_icons.h` is written in the code but discovered that the file it needs could not be found at all. Is the editor_icons.h missing from the source code or somehow accidentally deleted?

So I tried to redownload the source code from Github again, but this time the fatal error code generated this message instead:

```
[Initial build] Linking Static Library ==> editor\editor.windows.tools.64.lib
editor\editor_icons.gen.h : fatal error LNK1136: invalid or corrupt file
scons: *** [editor\editor.windows.tools.64.lib] Error 1136
scons: building terminated because of errors.
```

At the moment, I can't compile the latest Godot Engine from the source code. Hopefully what I have explained can help figure out how to solve this issue.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Compile the source code, using any native build command prompts provided by Visual Studio.

data.title: Sanitize Android debug
data.body:
~~'Remote debug over ADB' seems to be a left-behind of how Android debug worked a long time ago. Now it just breaks debugging.~~

~~What should be checked instead in order to enable remote debug and/or FS is just the fact that the project is deployed with such options toggled. Using ADB is always the case.~~

~~Also removing `DEBUG_FLAG_REMOTE_DEBUG_LOCALHOST`, which was being only used for that old Android scenario.~~

Reworked:
- _Commit 1:_ (the same as formerly but keeping localhost debug, needed for __`adb reverse`__)
'Remote debug over ADB' is removed as that will be always the case.
- _Commit 2:_
Fix Android remote debug not hitting breakpoints
RandomShaper committed an hour ago
A change in `Main`'s API is needed. Please read the comment in the diff for an explanation.

data.title: Sanitize Android debug (2.1)
data.body:
~~'Remote debug over ADB' seems to be a left-behind of how Android debug worked a long time ago. Now it just breaks debugging.~~

~~What should be checked instead in order to enable remote debug and/or FS is just the fact that the project is deployed with such options toggled. Using ADB is always the case.~~

~~Also removing `EXPORT_REMOTE_DEBUG_LOCALHOST`, which was being only used for that.~~

__UPDATE:__

Reworked:
- _Commit 1:_ (the same as formerly but keeping localhost debug, needed for __`adb reverse`__)
'Remote debug over ADB' is removed as that will be always the case.
- _Commit 2:_
Fix Android remote debug not hitting breakpoints
RandomShaper committed an hour ago
A change in `Main`'s API is needed. Please read the comment in the diff for an explanation.

Closes #10458.

data.title: removed new polygon antialiasing from styleBoxFlat fixes #10461
Can't open script if it's not using the default script template
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Elementary OS 0.4.1 - Latest version (compiled from github's files)

**Issue description:**
If you attach a new script with any template other than the default to a node, then that script cannot be opened and the console throws the following error:
 _editor/plugins/script_editor_plugin.cpp:1699 - Condition ' !se ' is true. returned: false_

**Steps to reproduce:**
Attach a new script to a node with any template different than the default and try to open it.

**Link to minimal example project:**
It can be reproduced with a new project.

data.title: Remove addition border
data.body:
the additional border function is not really necessary anymore since borders now can be achieved with:
```
sb->set_border_width_inidvidual(l, t, r, b);
sb->set_expand_margin_size_inidvidual(l, t, r, b);
```
this pr removes the function and adds convenience functions to StyleBox. so that additional border really is not necessary anymore.
[additional border function](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/compare/master...toger5:remove_addition_border?expand=1#diff-a303f0e6ee369856bcaf5dcf959c40e7L87)

data.title: Freelook and Zoom conflict
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux, Godot 3 master

**Issue description:**
                                                                                                                                                 
There seems to be a strange conflict between Freelook and
Zooming. Normally, scrolling with the Mouse wheel zooms in and
out (the indicator on the left moves up and down) within a certain range.

Zooming in and out (note the range):
![zoom](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7927471/29537143-e0531dce-86c0-11e7-9919-45f166d9b755.gif)

when Freelook is active, the mouse wheel controls the freelook
speed (the same indicator is used, but strangely in reverse) also within a range:

Setting Freelook speed to minimum:
![speed](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7927471/29537189-1e5d1b92-86c1-11e7-8069-64fb7050a0e2.gif)

However, both zooming and freelook speed seem to share the same "range", so
when leaving freelook mode, the zoom indicator is now where you left off in
freelook mode and thus has totally different minimum and maximum points for the
zoom, leading to strange results. (e.g. you can now zoom much more/less than before)

Attempt to zoom in closer (not possible anymore because of freelook speed):
![zoom_attempt](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7927471/29537233-4863f83e-86c1-11e7-907c-d3d70c4eabf6.gif)

```
        cwd = 0x102cbb7a0 "/home/wilson/gitrepos/godot-demo-projects/2d/platformer"
        err = <optimized out>
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
* Build Godot with GCC 7.1.1:
```shell
scons platform=x11 target=release_debug debug_release=yes CXX=g++ -j$(nproc) builtin_openssl=yes tools=yes bits=64
```
* Open the [2D platformer](https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/tree/master/2d/platformer) demo in the editor to import the assets.
* A segmentation fault occurs.

data.title: Fix spinboxes bad look
data.body:
Fixes this:
![2017-08-21-214248_556x315_scrot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6093119/29535604-c0857718-86ba-11e7-866a-0efcdccc37cb.png)

data.title: There are no buttons nor a label at the bottom of the screen in the Material Tester demo
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux - Godot Master Branch 4717d37bfa867d8cdcd4805967324978da6701b7

**Issue description:**
Take a look at the bottom of the screen:
![nobuttonsnorlabel](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8337880/29534920-eb490c10-8685-11e7-99c6-42a9f780e321.png)

There are no buttons on either side,  nor a label in the middle. I expected to see the same label and buttons I saw at the bottom back on #10311.

This issue was introduced between the 3bea3256f5def126b2b6d639ed70c4ddc3990344 and 4717d37bfa867d8cdcd4805967324978da6701b7 commits. I'll run a `git bisect` at some point to pinpoint the commit that introduced this problem.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Run the [material_testers](https://github.com/godotengine/godot-demo-projects/tree/master/3d/material_testers) demo.

data.title: fixed rounded corners for visual script editor
data.body: this fixes the first screenshot of: #10390

data.title: Mouse filters "stop" and "pass" have no difference
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 3.0.alpha 01d4ffd3ee8abbbfba45871ee8d83eee18d3bf97

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
"Control node -> mouse filter" doesn't seem to be working properly. I believe that "stop" and "pass" mouse filters should behave differently- "stop" should accept and stop input event and "pass" should accept the input event and pass it further, so that the Control nodes which are below could access the same event until it is either stopped somewhere or simply just becomes unhandled event.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Place two button nodes with some overlap; when user clicks on the overlapping area, only one button(the top one) gets pressed.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Fix y axis for set_window_position on OS X
data.body: Same as #10505 but for 2.1
